results.title: The Patrol method
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: This film is designed primarily for training of scout leaders in principles and methods of scouting, with the patrol as the basic unit. it is recommended that the Scout Leader see the film several times during the period of a year, so that he has an opportunity to apply what he learns about the technique of Patrol method, and then go back to restudy the film in light of his own methods.

results.title: The Patriot [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Mutual Film Company, Centropolis Entertainment, Dean Devlin, Mark Gordon, Gary Levinsohn and Roland Emmerich
results.brief_description: A historical drama set during the American Revolution, based on the true story of war hero, General Francis Marion. Following the death of his wife, Colonel Benjamin Martin is content to abandon his post in the army to raise his seven children on his plantation in South Carolina. Turning his back on violence, Benjamin is stunned when his oldest son, Gabriel, leaves home and joins the fight against the British Army, despite his father’s refusal to join the Continental Army. Gabriel is injured and makes his way home to warn his family the war is getting closer. His warning is too late however, and when the English arrive, a fight breaks out on Benjamin’s plantation. When Colonel Tavington kills his son, Thomas, and captures Gabriel, Benjamin rethinks his decision not to fight. Vowing to avenge his son’s death, he rescues Gabriel and together they form a militia group, made up of Carolina patriots who will do anything to stop the British troops, and their leader Lord General Cornwallis. Cast includes Mel Gibson, Heath Ledger, Joely Richardson, Jason Isaacs and Tom Wilkinson.

results.title: The Patient pedestrian
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian Road Safety Council
results.brief_description: Filmed in Sydney, this short safety trailer tells of the work the Road Safety Council is attempting to do to make the crossing of busy streets safe for the pedestrian. Commentary by Russ Tyson.

results.title: The Patched up fashion plate
results.brief_description: A girl (Linda Ingram) living in a battered timber house patches a pair of jeans. She walks among the second hand stores of Prahran and then the fashion boutiques of Toorak Road.

results.title: The Pastoral balance
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Malcolm Otton and Ian Hart
results.brief_description: Shows some of the features of the Australian beef cattle industry, concentrating on recent advances in breeding and pasture improvement. Examines modern pastoralism in terms of a systems approach, the inputs being land, livestock, capital and labour, and the outputs beef and modification of the environment.

results.title: The Pastfinders
results.brief_description: A drama set in the future, 1000 years from the twentieth century, when coins are found and the information fed into a computer it triggers its memory bank - what the coin was used for so long ago. This opening is a novel way to start a film about the dangers of cigarette smoking in the twentieth century. It shows the effects of smoking of human beings and the deaths caused by lung cancer.

results.title: The Passion to play
results.creator_credit: Hush Productions International, Peter Dickson and Rob Dickson
results.brief_description: Sport has the power to unite and also to divide. It has the ability to build a person’s confidence and at the same time destroy another’s spirit. Australian Rules Football has for generations provided individuals and communities with a distraction from the normal focus of life. Created by our natural desire for competition, it has thrilled the masses, and for many, provided a way of life. It is the players that determine its power and this video is a celebration of those players. Players past and present, representing the 16 different clubs, discuss the game and their careers, providing insight into the journey of playing Australian Rules Football as a senior, the thrill of the first game and the heartache of being told your time is up.

results.title: The Passion of the Christ
results.creator_credit: ICON, Mel Gibson, Bruce Davey and Stephen McEveety
results.brief_description: Written (with Benedict Fitzgerald), directed and produced by Mel Gibson, “The Passion of the Christ” is the realisation of a very personal project for Gibson. The film deals with the last twelve hours of Jesus of Nazareth’s life opening in the Garden of Gethsemane. Betrayed by the disciple Judas, Jesus (Jim Caviezel) is arrested and stands accused of blasphemy before religious leaders, who insist he should be punished by death. Before the crucifixion however, he is whipped and beaten and the graphic nature of the violence (torturous instruments that remove chunks of flesh shown in slow-motion) may prove too much for some viewers. The film employs the use of brief flashbacks as a vehicle to cover the last supper and life-changing experiences of other important people in his life; namely disciples, his mother Mary and Mary Magdalene. This religious drama uses the original languages of the day as an attempt to add to a more timeless and authentic telling of the story. Production design and cinematography give the film a painterly feel and majestic musical score adds to the emotional intensity, particularly at times when no dialogue is spoken. Cast includes, Maia Morgenstern, Hristo Jivkov, Monica Bellucci, Rosalinda Celentano.

results.title: The Passion of Spain
results.creator_credit: Grainger Maynard, Maynard and Greg Grainger
results.brief_description: As seen on ATN 7 on “The world around us”, this is a tour through Spain, looking at the diverse mix of ancient Spanish traditions and the new vibrancy which has swept through the country. Witness spectacular fairs and parades, as well as looking at the remote areas of the country, such as Galica, the Basque homelands and Gomera in the Canary Islands.
